Detailed Description

Error policy for constrained that wraps the new value over the bounds.

Definition at line 34 of file wrapping.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

void operator() ( V &  ov,
const V &  nv,
const within_bounds< L, U, boost::mpl::false_, boost::mpl::false_, std::less< V > > &  c 
) const

The policy invocation operator.

If nv is below the range, assigns the result of the following expression to ov: 

 c.upper_bound() - (c.lower_bound() - nv - 1) % (c.upper_bound() - c.lower_bound() + 1)
If nv is above the range, assigns the result of the following expression to ov: 
 c.lower_bound() + (nv - c.upper_bound() - 1) % (c.upper_bound() - c.lower_bound() + 1)

Note, that the expressions are not always fully overflow-safe. The types and bounds values should be selected appropriately to avoid overflows.

Remarks:
  • V, L and U must be types representing integer numbers or random access iterators, allowing for the arithmetic computations described above and for assignment of the result to V.
  • c must represent a valid range (the upper bound cannot be less than the lower bound).
